title: How to Draw a Stick Figure

steps.headline: Draw a circle for the head.
Draw a cross connected to the head.
Draw two legs branching from the bottom of the  cross.
steps.description: On the cross make sure the horizontal line is shorter than the vertical line.

steps.headline: Draw a curve or a straight line at the lower half of the circle.
steps.description: If you want teeth, draw two triangles sprouting from the line.

steps.headline: Draw two eyes.
steps.description:
You can draw:
A dot. It's the fastest way. Two circles with a dot in the middle. Two merged eyes to show fear or surprise. Dollar signs ($) and hearts can replace pupils to show expressions.

steps.headline: Draw a dot for the nose.

text:
Basic Body Draw a circle for the head.  Draw a cross connected to the head.  Draw two legs branching from the bottom of the  cross. On the cross make sure the horizontal line is shorter than the vertical line. Face Draw a curve or a straight line at the lower half of the circle. If you want teeth, draw two triangles sprouting from the line. Draw two eyes. You can draw:
A dot. It's the fastest way. Two circles with a dot in the middle. Two merged eyes to show fear or surprise. Dollar signs ($) and hearts can replace pupils to show expressions. Draw a dot for the nose.  Finished.
sentences: Basic Body Draw a circle for the head.
Draw a cross connected to the head.
Draw two legs branching from the bottom of the  cross.
On the cross make sure the horizontal line is shorter than the vertical line.
Face Draw a curve or a straight line at the lower half of the circle.
If you want teeth, draw two triangles sprouting from the line.
Two circles with a dot in the middle.
Two merged eyes to show fear or surprise.
Dollar signs ($) and hearts can replace pupils to show expressions.
Draw a dot for the nose.
